div.p: Ehrenfeucht's Conjecture states that each subset S of a finitely generated free monoid has a finite subset T such that if two endomorphisms of the monoid agree on T, then they agree On S. It is the purpose of this note to verify the conjecture.

Ehrenfeucht's Conjecture states that if ~/~k is the k-generated free monoid and S is a subset of Ms,, then there is a finite subset T of S such that if two endomorphisms on ~k agree on T, then they agree on S. This conjecture was made by Ehrenfeucht at the beginning of the 1970's and was motivated by formal language theory. It was first proved for k = 2 in [4]. In this paper we prove the following theorem.

div.head: Theorem. Ehrenfeucht's Conjecture is true.
div.p: There are several interesting consequences of Theorem 1. In particular, we have the following theorem.

div.p: That Theorem 1 implies Theorem 2 is proved in [3]. The reader is referred to [6] for an excellent survey of the work around the Ehrenfeucht's Conjecture including some consequences of Theorem 1.
